intro: Sida tricuspidata, commonly known as the three-lobed mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy, triangular leaves and small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other mallow species known for their showy flowers and cotton-like fibers. Sida tricuspidata typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
